Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.Models.ClassDiagram

Class UMLClassBox

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.Models.ClassDiagram.UMLClassBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
UMLElementBoxInterface
public class UMLClassBox extends Object implements UMLElementBoxInterface

UML Class Box

The UMLClassBox class represents a UML Class within the UML Editor application. It encapsulates the properties and behaviors of a UML class, including its name, position, attributes, methods, and visual representation. This class implements the UMLElementBoxInterface to ensure consistent access and modification of UML elements.

Key functionalities include:

  • Managing the name, position (X and Y coordinates), attributes, and methods of the class.
  • Handling the visual representation of the class as a VBox in the user interface.
  • Facilitating synchronization between the model and the view by updating the UI upon changes.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Constructor Details

    • UMLClassBox

      public UMLClassBox()
      Default constructor for Jackson deserialization.

      This constructor is necessary for the Jackson library to deserialize JSON data into a UMLClassBox instance.

    • UMLClassBox

      public UMLClassBox(String name, double x, double y, javafx.scene.layout.VBox visualRepresentation)
      Constructs a UMLClassBox with the specified name, position, and visual representation.

      This constructor initializes the class with a name, X and Y coordinates, and its visual VBox representation.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the class.
      x - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      y - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      visualRepresentation - The VBox representing the class in the UI.

    • UMLClassBox

      public UMLClassBox(String name, double x, double y, List<String> attributes, List<String> methods)
      Constructs a UMLClassBox with the specified name, position, attributes, and methods.

      This constructor initializes the class with a name, X and Y coordinates, as well as lists of attributes and methods. The visual VBox representation is set separately.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the class.
      x - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      y - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      attributes - The list of attributes for the class.
      methods - The list of methods for the class.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the UML class.

      This method updates the name of the class and reflects the change in its visual representation by updating the corresponding label.

      Specified by:
      setName in interface UMLElementBoxInterface
      Parameters:
      name - A String containing the new name for the class.

    • setX

      public void setX(double x)
      Sets the X-coordinate position of the UML class.

      This method updates the X-coordinate of the class and moves its visual representation to the new position.

      Specified by:
      setX in interface UMLElementBoxInterface
      Parameters:
      x - A double value indicating the new X-coordinate.

    • setY

      Specified by:
      setY in interface UMLElementBoxInterface
      Parameters:
      y - A double value indicating the new Y-coordinate.

    • setAttributes

      public void setAttributes(List<String> attributes)
      Sets the list of attributes for the UML class.

      This method updates the class's attributes and refreshes the visual representation to display the new attributes.

      Parameters:
      attributes - A List of String representing the new attributes.

    • setMethods

      public void setMethods(List<String> methods)
      Sets the list of methods for the UML class.

      This method updates the class's methods and refreshes the visual representation to display the new methods.

      Parameters:
      methods - A List of String representing the new methods.

    • setVisualRepresentation

      public void setVisualRepresentation(javafx.scene.layout.VBox visualRepresentation)
      Sets the visual representation of the UML class.

      This method assigns a VBox to represent the class in the user interface. It allows for dynamic updates to the UI based on changes to the class's properties.

      Specified by:
      setVisualRepresentation in interface UMLElementBoxInterface
      Parameters:
      visualRepresentation - A VBox representing the class in the UI.
